definitions.text: a headlong rush of people on a common impulse
examples: when he shouted `fire' there was a stampede to the exits

definitions.text: a wild headlong rush of frightened animals (horses or cattle)
cause a group or mass of people to act on an impulse or hurriedly and impulsively
examples: The tavern owners stampeded us into overeating

definitions.text: act, usually en masse, hurriedly or on an impulse
examples: Companies will now stampede to release their latest software
